pullRequest.title: GH-1982 fix duplicate dependency and several IntelliJ-specific build issues
pullRequest.bodyText:
GitHub issue resolved: #1982  
Briefly describe the changes proposed in this PR:
Various small fixes to maven and the build.


PR Author Checklist:

 my pull request is self-contained
 I've added tests for the changes I made
 every commit message starts with the issue number (GH-xxxx) followed by a meaningful description of the change
 every commit has been signed off

Note: we merge all feature pull requests using squash and merge. See RDF4J git merge strategy for more details.

commit.message:
GH-1982 remove duplicate

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

Upgrade source plugin to stop intellij from complaining about an unsupported tag

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

Explicit casting to make Intellij stop complaining about code that is actually correct

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText:
This shouldn't be necessary, as far as I can tell the code is legal without the cast. Are you getting an actual error in IntelliJ, or is it just giving a warning of some sort?
I'm not really in favor of changing legal code just to make one particular editor behave (for one thing it becomes tricky to maintain), but if it's really unworkable, I'd rather go with a a proper lambda (st -> reificationModel.add(st)) instead of this explicit cast.

commit.message:
Removed source configuration since it was added by mistake. Also downgraded the source plugin since upgrading actually didn't fix the issue

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>
